Text: Take care of yourself! \n Or pay someone a fair \n wage to do it.

Though I can't wrap 
 my head around all of 
 the problems that need 
 to be solved.
Lisa...
If only we knew what was \n driving that monster, we \n could find a way to stop it.
What!? Where's \n Cecie!?
Yeah, who knows when \n we'll leave the place...
It all happened \n so fast.

I never thought I'd 
 see the day when the 
 Lhao Tribe would take 
 back their islands...
The nice lady \n saved me.
Who knows what it wants!? \n The Council really left us \n in a mess.
That sounds like a great \n thing to learn. Teach me \n when you do.
Lisa's presiding over \n it, and Vogo and Fi are \n handling the minutes.
I'm gonna study how to \n make everyone happy!
I never cared much about \n government before...
Hey, Kat! The forum's \n over in the round \n theatre in Lei Havina.
If it weren't for her, \n the monster would've \n ate me.
When I grow up, I want \n to go to school!

We've gone on far too 
 long without having a 
 real discussion about 
 how this place is run.

Even if it's 
 step-by-step, as long as 
 we're moving in the 
 right direction...

Listen, about Neu 
 Hiraleon, that place the 
 monster is using for a 
 body...
But who knows what'll \n happen next?
The monster that had crossed dimensions and found its way \n to Jirga Para Lhao was Neu Hiraleon, the very place that \n triggered the strange storm that stole us from Hekseville.
Really!? Can you pick me \n up one too? I'll pay you \n back, I promise!
Th-The Council!
A town forum? \n Where's it at?
Listen up, \n I have a plan!
I agree!

I think so, Lisa asked 
 us to stay here and 
 watch the place while 
 she was gone.
Th-The town forum is \n about to start, \n isn't it?

They've been sitting on 
 their thrones so long, 
 they won't give 'em up 
 easily.
We can't go rushing in. \n Think about the town!

Representatives from 
 Elgona have headed out 
 to Havina to participate 
 in the town forum.
I don't belong to you. \n Not anymore!
But the Council is still \n alive and hiding in \n their bunker.
I'm sure things'll be \n fine...
Tell her good luck for \n me!
Neu Hiraleon...
Well, if you're headin' \n over, check on Lisa for \n me.
Lisa'll figure it out, \n we can trust her to do \n the right thing.
Today's the town forum \n in Lei Havina, isn't it?
I'm going to grab a Lhao \n skewer. They're having a \n half-off sale.
I can't live without \n you. Please. Don't go!
It's coming, run!
Interesting! I'd like to \n hear what they have to \n say.

Hope they're enjoying 
 that thing's stomach. 
 Maybe they'll give it 
 indigestion.
Looks like their roles \n have been reversed...
I should try to be more \n like you and see the \n bright side.
Everyone in Jirga Para \n Lhao is about to discuss \n the city's future.
You always helped me \n before...
No, I'm heading there \n now. How about you?

The people who live here 
 should decide the town's 
 future. I'm staying out 
 of it.
Syd's idea - if there were even a small chance he was right, \n we had to act on it.
Lisa! I'll find her.
Most of the Garrison \n have sided with the \n people...
I will. And I hope \n this'll be a productive \n talk.
Wait!
I thought you would've \n gone over to Lei Havina \n with Syd by now.
It's all thanks to you \n this day has come.
Today's the day when they're having that important gathering.

So this is the place 
 where they're 
 having the forum... 
 It's packed!
String up everyone from \n the government and Lei \n Havina!
First things first, we \n redistribute the wealth \n they've been hoarding!

Hmph, great plan. And 
 after you string us up, 
 who do you expect to pay 
 taxes?
Our burden is higher \n than yours, why should \n we give up what we have?

Any harmony we've 
 enjoyed is because we've 
 always maintained strict 
 class divisions.
Everyone has their \n place, you'd throw us \n into chaos!
Hey! It's your fault \n we're-

This isn't gonna be 
 easy to sort out. 
 I wonder what 
 Lisa's saying.
Escape the Lost City

This is sedition! The 
 mainland is probably 
 sending reinforcements 
 as we speak.
They've already fallen \n into decay, they don't \n have troops to spare.
The Council lied, \n the mainland has \n long forgotten you.
You're the liar! \n You think we're going \n to put up with this!?

That's not all. We've received 
 reports from traders that the area 
 around Jirga Para Lhao is growing 
 more and more unstable.

What do you know!? Lhao - or 
 whatever you call yourself. 
 What right do you have to 
 stand up there and talk down 
 to us?
Mummy, what's gonna \n happen to us now?
It's okay, dear. \n Daddy and Mommy will \n protect you.
A change in position brings \n about a change in perspective. \n And real change is hard.
Yeah...
One side's justice was another side's injustice. \n And I had no idea how that gap would ever be \n bridged.
On one side was Lisa, who risked everything for \n Jirga Para Lhao. On the other were the citizens \n who had grown wealthy under the Council.
Meanwhile, the Council of Elders, holed up in \n their bunker, were adding to our troubles.
And we were unprepared for the calamity that befell us.
She must be feeling the \n pains of governing about now.
What does a mining woman \n know about running a city?
Hmph, let her wear \n herself out trying to \n play leader.
Little girls don't know how \n to play with real power. \n They lack the vision to lead.
We'll continue firing on the rift \n to keep the entrance open.
When the upstart's done, \n we'll resume our- \n Wait, what was that?
Raven: \n It'll drag us in, we have to get some distance!
I have to save the people in Havina!
Lei Havina Man: \n I-It's going to pull in the theatre!
What's going on!?
H-Help! A monster is \n attacking Lei Havina!

A whole city just came 
 to life, and it's 
 rampaging through our 
 home!

We don't have enough 
 airboats to evacuate and 
 the military can't 
 do anything!
Lisa, dispatch the \n fleet. They need \n rescuing!

I understand your desire 
 to help them, but we 
 need to consider this 
 carefully.
Lisa? What are you \n talking about!? We don't \n have time for this!

I can't ask the people 
 who've suffered under 
 Lei Havina to make that 
 kind of sacrifice.
Think of the bigger \n picture - the safety of \n Jirga Para Lhao.

Please, my wife and 
 child are stranded in 
 the mansion. I don't 
 know what to do!

Who cares who did what 
 to who? What's past is 
 past. They need help 
 now!
We're going with or \n without you. Come on, \n Raven!
Let's go check on his \n family at the mansion \n first.
This is the man's \n mansion, where's his \n family?
Nobody's home, but \n someone left a note \n they're evacuating.
I guess that means they \n made it out safely then.
Is that thing... eating \n the island?
Let's split up, I'll \n keep it distracted.
You save the rest of the \n people.
Got it! Be careful, \n Raven.
What are you two doing \n here?
I-I couldn't ignore \n those poor people.
I brought bombs from the \n Bismalia in case they \n could help.
But I don't think \n they'll make a dent in \n that thing.
We have to do \n something to \n evacuate the stragglers.
Hey-uh...
If only there was \n something we could do.
Oh-uh...
Just stay out of its \n way, Raven's barely able \n to distract it.
K-Kat! Syd!
Wha-!? What is it Cecie?
Th-That island the \n monster's on...
There's a bridge between \n it and this island.
If we blew it up with \n Syd's bombs...
We'd separate the \n islands. Brilliant!
And prevent that thing \n from destroying anything \n else.
Great idea Cecie! Let's \n try it.
I-I just hope I \n could help.
Kat, it's all up to you \n now.
But I only brought so \n many bombs. You'll have \n to make 'em count.
That thing just \n swallowed the theatre!
It's not just eating, \n it's growing!
It won't stop until it's \n consumed everything in \n Jirga Para Lhao.

No... 
 How are we supposed 
 to get those people 
 to safety?
It's not going to be \n easy with just the \n two of us...
We have to try...
I know, but I \n think we're beat \n on this one...
Lisa!
Sorry we're late. \n You were right, \n you always are...
In an emergency, there's \n no such thing as a \n social class.
We're here to do \n everything we can to \n help Lei Havina.
Lisa!
Okay! You concentrate on \n rescuing the people.
We'll keep that monster \n off of you.
Did we do it...?
It stopped moving...
Yeah, but there's no way \n to tell for how long.
We should discuss what \n to do next with Lisa...
I need to destroy that bridge!
Oh no!
Syd: \n Aaah!
Cecie: \n Aaah!
Raven: \n Watch those arms!
Raven: \n I think it's working.
Raven: \n We need to get back!
Raven: \n We should be safe back at the airboat!
Raven: \n We need to get over there!
Raven: \n Now's our chance to attack!
Raven: \n Let's hit that monster!
Raven: \n You've gotta be more careful.
Raven: \n Watch out for those Nevi!
Destroy the Lost City's Arms
Raven: \n Watch that gas coming from the cores, it can't be good.
Raven: \n I'll take the arm in the middle, you take the left.
Raven: \n That's it, the arms are gone!
There goes the right arm!
That takes care of the left arm!
No more middle arm!
That's all of the arms.
Raven: \n Only the left arm's left now.
Raven: \n Just the right arm left.
Raven: \n We have to take care of its left and right arms!
Raven: \n It only has the middle arm left.
Raven: \n It still has its middle and right arms.
Raven: \n It still has its middle and left arms.
I have to take out the Nevi on its arm.
Raven: \n Take out those Nevi connecting its arms!
I have to get in fast before those tentacles close!
I just need to be light if I want to zip in...
Head to the Man's Mansion
That's the city from the Forbidden Land!
Neu Hiraleon... It just came to life!
We have to save the stragglers.
Wh-What!?
Raven: \n Get back!
What the-!?
What is that thing...?
Save the People
There are so many people... What can I do?
Huh? Syd!
Time Left:
Blow the Bridge \n with the Explosives
Time to take out that bridge!
Raven got its arm! And this bridge is almost done for.
The bridge is blown!
Little Girl: \n Mummy!
Save the Child
That little girl got stranded over there!
Escort the Girl \n to the Others
Little Girl: \n Thank you for saving me!
The Council's just... gone.
I have to get to that guy's mansion.
I need to get this little girl to safety.
Havina Man: \n Aah... Havina's done for!
The bombs are working!
Syd: \n Hey, Kat! You need an explosive for the bridge.
Syd: \n That's it, keep it up!
Syd: \n That bridge is almost done for!
Syd: \n Finish that bridge off with the bombs!
This is a new age, I'm a \n free man!
Wait! Who's going to \n take care of me?
